title: Behaviour modification: teaching language to psychotic children (TEFC)
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Autism
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Behavior therapy
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Child psychology
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Psychotherapy
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Schizophrenia
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Child psychology
description: Shows typical speech patterns of autistic and schizophrenic children, and discusses correction of these before learning begins. Demonstrates instruction methods in imitation of sounds, labelling of objects, discrimination between alternatives, recall of experiences, and development of some spontaneity.
